intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. subrectiforme, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are broadly lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes.
